title: Day 4
message:
**Object and Array Methods**

objects and arrays hold values differently 

arrays -- zero index list to organize values

objects -- key value pairs to organize values.

array = \[\] using bracket notation
object = \{\} using bracket or dot notation

arr.splice(startingPosition, numberToRemove, newValue)


**Array Methods**

method -- a property that contains a function definition

used to share behaviors in instances of the same data type.

manipulating arrays
letters.push(f) -- adds value to the end of an array and returns the new length of the array.

letters.pop() -- removes last element in an array and returns the element that was removed
